verbs.description: vide (third-person singular simple present vides, present participle viding, simple past and past participle vided)

entries.meaning: (US, African-American Vernacular) divide (separate into parts, cleave asunder)
(Parliamentary jargon, imperative) Divide (ordering the members of a legislative assembly to divide into two groups (the ayes and the nays) for the counting of the members’ votes)

description: From Latin vidē (“see!”), second-person singular present active imperative form of videō (“I see”).

entries.meaning: See; consult; refer to. A remark directing the reader to look to the specified place for epexegesis.
